name: 程聖倫
objective: In this course, students will gain a conceptual understanding of ways to implement a training program, different models of evaluation, and the rationale for evaluating a program or the objectives and intent of the organization. Students will identify whether and where evaluation is needed, and how the evaluation contributes to the overall goals of the organization as well as the learning identified as necessary. Students will gain practical experience with the notion of evaluation as well as what is  to be done with the evaluation’s findings.
schedule:
week 1: Overview of the course

week 2: (implementation) Training delivery methods, on-the-job training methods, & classroom training approaches

week 3: (implementation) The lecture approach, the discussion method, & audiovisual media

week 4: (implementation) Computer-based training, self-paced media and methods, & arranging the physical environment

week 5: (evaluation) Foundations of evaluation

week 6: (evaluation) Principles of performance-based evaluation

week 7: (evaluation) Overview of existing evaluation models 

week 8: (evaluation) Kirkpatrick's four levels of evaluation

week 9: Mid-term

week 10: (evaluation) Phillip's return-on-investment methodology 

week 11: (evaluation) Brinkerhoff's success case method 

week 12: (evaluation) The impact evaluation process model

week 13: (evaluation) The CIPP model

week 14: (evaluation) Evaluating evaluations

week 15: (evaluation) Data collection

week 16: (evaluation) Analysis of evaluation data: Tools and techniques

week 17: (evaluation) Communicating the findings

week 18: Final
scorePolicy:
Attendance 20%
In-class presentation 40%
Final evaluation report 40%
